page.title: 11Food & diet (Harberton)
page.content:
People make an effort to grow as many vegetables and as much fruit as they can. Many of the village gardens are small but allotments are available.
There is a general awareness of the importance of a healthy diet and some people are eating less meat and dairy products. Along with the interest in food and diet has come a revival in the growth and use of herbs. The preparation of food is much aided by recent innovations in electrical kitchen equipment. Many households rely on mixers and food processors and with no shops locally the freezer is considered by many to be essential for meat, bread, and surplus garden produce storage.
